bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 99 (Wednesday, June 7, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NEHLS:H.R. 3920.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:The Prioritizing the Removal of Migrants Act would codify a2017 Executive Order signed by President Trump, in order tolimit this prosecutorial discretion and ensure the faithfulexecution of the immigration laws of the United Statesagainst all removable aliens.[Page H2781]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
Prioritizing the Removal of Migrants Act

This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security to prioritize immigration enforcement actions relating to certain groups of non-U.S. nationals (aliens under federal law), including those who (1) were apprehended in the United States after entering unlawfully after November 1, 2020, (2) have been convicted or charged with any criminal offense,  (3) are deportable or removable on grounds related to crime or security, or (4) have abused any public benefits program.

bill.title: Prioritizing the Removal of Migrants Act

item.title: Prioritizing the Removal of Migrants Act
Prioritizing the Removal of Migrants Act
To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to prioritize the removal of certain aliens, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
